characters.name: Bathala
characters.description: Bathala, also known as Maykapal, is the supreme deity in Tagalog mythology, revered as the creator and ruler of the universe. With immense power and wisdom, Bathala oversees all aspects of life and the cosmos, embodying the highest divine authority. His presence is often associated with the harmony of nature and the balance of existence.

characters.name: Maria Makiling
characters.description: Maria Makiling is a prominent figure in Tagalog folklore, renowned as a powerful diwata or fairy of the mountains. She is often depicted as a beautiful and enigmatic woman who possesses mystical abilities and is deeply connected to nature. Known for her wisdom and grace, Maria Makiling is both revered and feared for her unpredictable nature and her role in protecting the forest.

characters.name: Bakunawa
characters.description: Bakunawa is a legendary serpent-like dragon from Philippine mythology, often associated with eclipses and lunar cycles. Believed to cause eclipses by attempting to devour the moon, Bakunawa is a formidable and fearsome creature that embodies both the mysteries and the dangers of the night sky. Its massive, serpentine form and celestial role make it a significant figure in various myths and stories.

characters.name: Minokawa
characters.description: Minokawa is a mythical bird from Bagobo folklore, described as a colossal, raven-like creature with a voracious appetite for the moon. This fearsome entity is said to cause lunar eclipses by attempting to swallow the moon, embodying the ancient fears and celestial phenomena that shaped Bagobo cosmology. Minokawa's dramatic presence in mythology highlights its role as a powerful and ominous force in the heavens.

characters.name: Lam-ang
characters.source: Ang Badass na Buhay ni Lam-ang
characters.description: Lam-ang was born in the middle of the warring times between the Ilocanos and Igorots. He has a deep-rooted hatred for Igorots, and tends to take out armies of them singlehandedly. He is said to have been born with a sword, which he himself forged from within the womb. He is a legendary warrior who knows no equal.

characters.name: Maria Cristina
characters.description: Maria Cristina is a legendary figure from Filipino folklore, associated with the majestic Maria Cristina Falls. Known for her beauty and strength, Maria Cristina is said to have been a powerful warrior or a nymph who protected the falls with her life. Her story intertwines with the natural splendor of the falls, symbolizing both the beauty and the mystical forces of the region.

characters.name: Agua Bendita
characters.description: Agua Cristi and Bendita Cristi, twin siblings born under the blessing of holy water; the former, born with a defect of having watery skin and healing tears and the latter, a normal human initially adamant about having the former as a sister but later learned to love her.

characters.name: Noel
characters.description: The oldest among the four protagonists, he has a tendency to betray his own 'friends' at the drop of a hat. He is also a survivor of the disease known as male pattern baldness. During adventures, he has a tendency to lose his pants. He has also been known to borrow lighters from friends and drinking buddies and never return them.

characters.name: Sandra
characters.description: She has been referred to as 'the one who carries a bag' and as someone who doesn't pay her taxes. She had also received a Colt Python pistol in her barrio once after winning a singing contest.

characters.name: Koontz
characters.description: He is the thinnest among the four CFCCA. He believes himself to be the toughest among the group and has a tendency to suggest the use of violence and brutal physicality to save their hides. He has a romantic side, though, developed through months of playing a variety of romantic hentai games.

characters.name: Charlie
characters.description: It is unknown why Charlie actually works in a call center as his family owns a multi-national company. As a toddler, he had excelled in various track and field competitions. Not all is peachy in his life, though, as Charlie admits to having been suicidal at different points in his life mostly due to having been given the same lunch everyday. But to his yaya, this existentialist angst is unexplained because Charlie was the one who was responsible for ordering his own lunch everyday.

characters.name: Santelmo
characters.description: Derived from 'Saint Elmo's fire', these fiery wisps are lost souls wandering the sprawling fields in search of the afterlife.
